alert.note: Alert for Concho; McCulloch (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 26 at 5:05PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern McCulloch and southeastern Concho Counties through 545 PM CDT... At 504 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Eden, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Brady, Eden, Melvin, Waldrip, Brady Lake, Salt Gap, Lohn, Pear Valley, Doole, The Intersection Of Us-87 And Ranch Road 2134 and Us- 83 Near The Menard-Concho County Line. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for west central Texas.
